u.a: second element of cluster deleted in "draw"; vowel change in "Phil";
aı sɔ ə pi:s ə lɛɡəʊ
lʌki wɒnts tu kʌm ðıs weı kɒs i:z hæpi ðıs weı .
n̩ ðæt steız ın ə mıdʊ
aı dəʊn wɒn tə ɡəʊ tə bɛd
ʃɒps ız [*] kləʊzd ɒn sʌndeı tədeı
means to say 'the shops are closed because it's Sunday today';
ðıs wʌn kɑ:nt fıt ɒn naʊ
means to say 'pat me on the back because I'm choking'
means to say 'take out the piece which tastes nasty'
maın ız ɒrındʒ n̩ dʒɛnız rɛd
ðɛəz ə skıpıŋ rəʊp hıə n̩ ə skıpıŋ rəʊp ðɛə .
wɒnt tə ɡəʊ ın ðə wɔ:m si:t
u [*] wɒʃ jɔ ʃtɒkıŋz [*] tənaıt ɒn sʌndeı
voiced lateral approximant deleted in "you"; voiceless alveolar fricatve replaced by voiceless alveolar lateral fricative in "stockings";

g.ga: you are silly to call me Jenny , since my name is Lucy

u.a: u [*] ız [*] sıli tə kɔʊ dʒɛni
voiced lateral approximant deleted in "you; is = are;

CHAT.comment: 1. Lucy has the habit of stringing together series of adverbial phrases in a sentence , which are mutually contradictory e.g. Mummy's going out tonight on Sunday. 2. FR was the first tune learnt after F and was used to indicate (i) question , (ii) emphatic contrast , (iii) contradiction.
